children.name: a
children.sourceText: What does the scripture mean, which saith that God placed cherubim and a flaming sword on the east of the garden of Eden, lest our first parents should enter and partake of the fruit of the tree of life, and live forever?

children.name: an
children.sourceText: What is this that thou hast said, that man should rise from the dead and be changed from this mortal to an immortal state that the soul can never die?

children.name: and
children.sourceText: What is this that thou hast said, that man should rise from the dead and be changed from this mortal to an immortal state that the soul can never die?

children.name: the
children.sourceText: What is this that thou hast said, that man should rise from the dead and be changed from this mortal to an immortal state that the soul can never die?

children.name: there
children.sourceText: And thus we see that there was no possible chance that they should live forever.
